mdRecord.dcterms:title: By His Excellency, the Hon. Thomas Gage, Esq. Governor, and Commander in Chief, in and over His Majesty's Province of Massachusetts-Bay, and Vice-Admiral of the same. A proclamation: Whereas the infatuated multitudes / Given at Boston, this twelfth day of June .. Annoque Domini, 1775. ; Tho's Gage. ; By His Excellency's Command, Tho's Flucker, Secr'y. ; God save the King
Proclamation
Whereas the infatuated multitudes
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Albert H. Small Declaration of Independence Collection (University of Virginia) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Text printed in one column, with a cut of the royal arms at top of sheet. [original]
Condemns the insurgency of 19 Apr. 1775 and subsequent armed attacks, grants amnesty except to Samuel Adams and John Hancock, and declares martial law in Massachusetts-Bay. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Albert H. Small Declaration of Independence Collection. Gift of Albert H. Small, December 27 & 28, 2001. FRAMED. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Massachusetts--History--Revolution, 1775-1783
